one_line_questions.question: What is rotation of the Earth?
one_line_questions.answer: Rotation is the spinning of Earth on its axis.

one_line_questions.question: What is revolution of the Earth?
one_line_questions.answer: Revolution is Earth’s movement around the Sun.

one_line_questions.question: What is Earth’s axis?
one_line_questions.answer: The axis is an imaginary line through Earth’s centre.

one_line_questions.question: How long does Earth take to rotate once?
one_line_questions.answer: Earth takes about 24 hours to rotate once.

one_line_questions.question: What is one rotation of Earth called?
one_line_questions.answer: One rotation of Earth is called a day.

one_line_questions.question: What causes day and night?
one_line_questions.answer: Earth’s rotation causes day and night.

one_line_questions.question: Which part of Earth has day?
one_line_questions.answer: The part facing the Sun has day.

one_line_questions.question: Which part of Earth has night?
one_line_questions.answer: The part away from the Sun has night.

one_line_questions.question: How long does Earth take to revolve around the Sun?
one_line_questions.answer: Earth takes about 365¼ days.

one_line_questions.question: What is one revolution of Earth called?
one_line_questions.answer: One revolution of Earth is called a year.

one_line_questions.question: Why do we have leap year?
one_line_questions.answer: To adjust the extra quarter day each year.

one_line_questions.question: How many days are there in a leap year?
one_line_questions.answer: A leap year has 366 days.

one_line_questions.question: Which month has an extra day in leap year?
one_line_questions.answer: February has an extra day.

one_line_questions.question: What is the extra day called?
one_line_questions.answer: The extra day is called February 29.

one_line_questions.question: What causes seasons on Earth?
one_line_questions.answer: Earth’s revolution and tilted axis cause seasons.

one_line_questions.question: How many seasons are there in a year?
one_line_questions.answer: There are four seasons in a year.

one_line_questions.question: Name the four seasons.
one_line_questions.answer: Summer, winter, rainy and spring are the seasons.

one_line_questions.question: Why does Earth have seasons?
one_line_questions.answer: Because Earth’s axis is tilted.

one_line_questions.question: What happens during summer?
one_line_questions.answer: Days are longer and nights are shorter.

one_line_questions.question: What happens during winter?
one_line_questions.answer: Nights are longer and days are shorter.

one_line_questions.question: What is equator?
one_line_questions.answer: The equator is an imaginary line around Earth’s middle.

one_line_questions.question: What does the equator divide Earth into?
one_line_questions.answer: It divides Earth into northern and southern hemispheres.

one_line_questions.question: What are hemispheres?
one_line_questions.answer: Hemispheres are two halves of the Earth.

one_line_questions.question: What is Northern Hemisphere?
one_line_questions.answer: It is the half of Earth north of the equator.

one_line_questions.question: What is Southern Hemisphere?
one_line_questions.answer: It is the half of Earth south of the equator.

one_line_questions.question: When is summer in the Northern Hemisphere?
one_line_questions.answer: It is summer from March to September.

one_line_questions.question: When is winter in the Northern Hemisphere?
one_line_questions.answer: It is winter from September to March.

one_line_questions.question: Do both hemispheres have same seasons together?
one_line_questions.answer: No, seasons are opposite in hemispheres.

one_line_questions.question: When is it summer in India?
one_line_questions.answer: Summer in India is from March to June.

one_line_questions.question: Which season comes after summer in India?
one_line_questions.answer: The rainy season comes after summer.

one_line_questions.question: What is the rainy season also called?
one_line_questions.answer: It is also called the monsoon season.

one_line_questions.question: Which season comes after rainy season?
one_line_questions.answer: Winter comes after the rainy season.

one_line_questions.question: Which season comes after winter?
one_line_questions.answer: Spring comes after winter.

one_line_questions.question: Why are days longer in summer?
one_line_questions.answer: The Sun’s rays fall directly on that part.

one_line_questions.question: Why are nights longer in winter?
one_line_questions.answer: The Sun’s rays fall slantingly.

one_line_questions.question: What is solstice?
one_line_questions.answer: Solstice is the longest or shortest day.

one_line_questions.question: When is the longest day in the Northern Hemisphere?
one_line_questions.answer: Around 21st June.

one_line_questions.question: When is the shortest day in the Northern Hemisphere?
one_line_questions.answer: Around 22nd December.

one_line_questions.question: What is equinox?
one_line_questions.answer: Equinox is when day and night are equal.

one_line_questions.question: How many equinoxes occur in a year?
one_line_questions.answer: Two equinoxes occur in a year.

one_line_questions.question: When does spring equinox occur?
one_line_questions.answer: Around 21st March.

one_line_questions.question: When does autumn equinox occur?
one_line_questions.answer: Around 23rd September.

one_line_questions.question: Why does the Sun appear to rise in the east?
one_line_questions.answer: Because Earth rotates from west to east.

one_line_questions.question: Why does the Sun appear to set in the west?
one_line_questions.answer: Due to Earth’s rotation.

one_line_questions.question: What is twilight?
one_line_questions.answer: Twilight is the faint light after sunset.

one_line_questions.question: What is dawn?
one_line_questions.answer: Dawn is the early light before sunrise.

one_line_questions.question: Why do poles experience long days and nights?
one_line_questions.answer: Due to Earth’s tilted axis.

one_line_questions.question: What is midnight sun?
one_line_questions.answer: The Sun visible at midnight in polar regions.

one_line_questions.question: Where is midnight sun seen?
one_line_questions.answer: Near the Arctic and Antarctic Circles.

one_line_questions.question: What is Earth’s tilt angle?
one_line_questions.answer: Earth is tilted at about 23½ degrees.

one_line_questions.question: Why is Earth’s tilt important?
one_line_questions.answer: It causes seasons.

one_line_questions.question: Does Earth’s axis change direction?
one_line_questions.answer: No, it always points in the same direction.

one_line_questions.question: What would happen if Earth had no tilt?
one_line_questions.answer: There would be no seasons.

one_line_questions.question: What causes unequal heating of Earth?
one_line_questions.answer: Tilt and curved surface of Earth.

one_line_questions.question: Which areas receive direct sunlight?
one_line_questions.answer: Areas near the equator.

one_line_questions.question: Which areas receive slanting sunlight?
one_line_questions.answer: Areas near the poles.

one_line_questions.question: Why are polar regions cold?
one_line_questions.answer: They receive slanting Sun rays.

one_line_questions.question: Why are equatorial regions hot?
one_line_questions.answer: They receive direct Sun rays.

one_line_questions.question: How does revolution affect climate?
one_line_questions.answer: It changes seasons.

one_line_questions.question: What is Earth’s movement on axis called?
one_line_questions.answer: Rotation.

one_line_questions.question: What is Earth’s movement around Sun called?
one_line_questions.answer: Revolution.

one_line_questions.question: Which movement causes day and night?
one_line_questions.answer: Rotation causes day and night.

one_line_questions.question: Which movement causes seasons?
one_line_questions.answer: Revolution causes seasons.

one_line_questions.question: How many hours are there in a day?
one_line_questions.answer: There are 24 hours in a day.

one_line_questions.question: How many months are there in a year?
one_line_questions.answer: There are 12 months in a year.

one_line_questions.question: Why is a year not exactly 365 days?
one_line_questions.answer: Because of the extra quarter day.

one_line_questions.question: How often does a leap year occur?
one_line_questions.answer: Once every four years.

one_line_questions.question: Which season is the coldest?
one_line_questions.answer: Winter is the coldest season.

one_line_questions.question: Which season is the hottest?
one_line_questions.answer: Summer is the hottest season.

one_line_questions.question: Why do seasons change gradually?
one_line_questions.answer: Because Earth moves slowly around the Sun.

one_line_questions.question: Does Earth’s speed of rotation change?
one_line_questions.answer: No, it remains nearly constant.

one_line_questions.question: What happens if Earth stops rotating?
one_line_questions.answer: One side would have day and the other night.

one_line_questions.question: Why is life possible on Earth?
one_line_questions.answer: Due to proper rotation and revolution.

one_line_questions.question: Which season has moderate temperature?
one_line_questions.answer: Spring has moderate temperature.

one_line_questions.question: Which season has heavy rainfall in India?
one_line_questions.answer: Rainy season has heavy rainfall.

one_line_questions.question: What happens to shadows at noon?
one_line_questions.answer: Shadows become very short.

one_line_questions.question: Why are shadows long in morning and evening?
one_line_questions.answer: Because the Sun is low in the sky.

one_line_questions.question: What is Earth’s shape called?
one_line_questions.answer: Earth is nearly spherical.

one_line_questions.question: Why is Earth called a rotating planet?
one_line_questions.answer: Because it spins on its axis.

one_line_questions.question: What happens to time due to rotation?
one_line_questions.answer: Different places have different time.

one_line_questions.question: Why do we have different time zones?
one_line_questions.answer: Due to Earth’s rotation.

one_line_questions.question: What is local time?
one_line_questions.answer: Time according to Sun’s position.

one_line_questions.question: Which line helps calculate time?
one_line_questions.answer: Longitude helps calculate time.

one_line_questions.question: Why does sunrise time change daily?
one_line_questions.answer: Due to Earth’s revolution.

one_line_questions.question: Why does sunset time change daily?
one_line_questions.answer: Because of Earth’s tilted axis.

one_line_questions.question: What is the Tropic of Cancer?
one_line_questions.answer: It is an important latitude in the north.

one_line_questions.question: What is the Tropic of Capricorn?
one_line_questions.answer: It is an important latitude in the south.

one_line_questions.question: Why are tropics important?
one_line_questions.answer: They receive direct sunlight.

one_line_questions.question: Which season begins with March equinox?
one_line_questions.answer: Spring season begins.

one_line_questions.question: Which season begins with September equinox?
one_line_questions.answer: Autumn season begins.

one_line_questions.question: Why do farmers depend on seasons?
one_line_questions.answer: Crops grow according to seasons.

one_line_questions.question: How do seasons affect animals?
one_line_questions.answer: Animals adapt their behaviour.

one_line_questions.question: Why do birds migrate?
one_line_questions.answer: To escape extreme seasons.

one_line_questions.question: What happens to plants in winter?
one_line_questions.answer: Growth slows down.

one_line_questions.question: What happens to plants in summer?
one_line_questions.answer: Plants grow rapidly.

one_line_questions.question: Why is rotation important for life?
one_line_questions.answer: It balances heat on Earth.

one_line_questions.question: Why is revolution important for life?
one_line_questions.answer: It creates suitable seasons.

one_line_questions.question: What would happen without day and night?
one_line_questions.answer: Life would become difficult.

one_line_questions.question: Why is Earth’s motion important?
one_line_questions.answer: It supports life on Earth.
